MS MCQs

    Create a custom connector to extend Power Platform functionalities with Business Central

    »

    1. When you create a custom connector and want to create a POST request, which definition do you need to determine?

      Triggers

      Actions

      Policies

      References


    2. When you configure Actions, you need to configure a Response. Which is the correct statement about Responses?

      A Response defines the shape of response returned by the underlying connector when making the request.

      A Response defines the shape of response returned by the underlying connector when making the trigger.

      A Response defines the pre-requirements needed in order to make a request.

      A Response area displays any issues that are detected in the API definition.


    3. You can share a custom connector with other users in the organization. What permissions can you give to users?

      Can view or Can edit.

      Can view, Can view + share, or Can edit.

      Can view, Can share, or Can edit.

      Can use, Can share, Can Save, or Can edit.


    4. When you are preparing parameters for the creation of custom connectors, one of the important parameters is Tenant ID. Where you can find the Tenant ID that you’ll use later?

      Tenant ID can be found only in the Business Central Admin Center.

      Tenant ID can be found when you open Page Inspection from the Companies page.

      Tenant ID can be found in the Business Central Admin Center or in My Settings in Business Central.

      Tenant ID can be found in the Business Central Admin Center or in the URL of your Business Central.
